## 📊 Benchmark Details

<table>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Name</strong></td><td>
NeuTral Rewriter
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Overview</strong></td><td>
A rule-based and neural approach to gender-neutral rewriting, providing alternatives for gendered English sentences.
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Data Type</strong></td><td>
Synthetic and natural language data
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Domains</strong></td><td>
<ul>
<li>Natural Language Processing</li>
<li>Gender-Neutral Language</li>
</ul>
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Languages</strong></td><td>
<ul>
<li>English</li>
</ul>
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Similar Benchmarks</strong></td><td>
<ul>
<li>WinoBias</li>
<li>Sun et al. (2021)</li>
</ul>
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Resources</strong></td><td>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github.com/anonymous-until-publication/NeuTralRewriter">GitHub Repository</a></li>
<li><a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/">Resource</a></li>
</ul>
</td></tr>
</table>

## 🎯 Purpose and Intended Users

<table>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Goal</strong></td><td>
Provide gender-neutral alternatives and increase inclusiveness in NLP applications.
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Target Audience</strong></td><td>
<ul>
<li>Researchers in NLP</li>
<li>Developers of language technology</li>
</ul>
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Tasks</strong></td><td>
<ul>
<li>Gender-neutral rewriting</li>
<li>Debiasing training data</li>
</ul>
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Limitations</strong></td><td>
Currently limited to English; potential to extend to other languages in future work.
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Out of Scope Uses</strong></td><td>
<ul>
<li>Targeting specific referents for pronoun changes</li>
</ul>
</td></tr>
</table>

## 💾 Data

<table>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Source</strong></td><td>
WinoBias+, OpenSubtitles, Reddit
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Size</strong></td><td>
Over 4 million sentences (including synthetic and natural)
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Format</strong></td><td>
Text
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Annotation</strong></td><td>
Manual curation and correction of gender-neutral alternatives
</td></tr>
</table>

## 🔬 Methodology

<table>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Methods</strong></td><td>
<ul>
<li>Rule-based rewriting</li>
<li>Neural machine translation</li>
</ul>
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Metrics</strong></td><td>
<ul>
<li>Word Error Rate</li>
</ul>
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Calculation</strong></td><td>
WER calculated by comparing generated outputs to correct neutral forms.
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Interpretation</strong></td><td>
Lower WER indicates better performance in generating gender-neutral alternatives.
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Baseline Results</strong></td><td>
WER below 0.18%
</td></tr>
<tr><td width="20%" align="center"><strong>Validation</strong></td><td>
Errors evaluated on both synthetic and natural benchmarks.
</td></tr>
</table>
